title: How to Make a Mexican Bean Toast

steps.headline: Heat the oil in a pan.
steps.description: Add the cumin seeds to the oil and cook until they oil sputters. Then add half teaspoon of garlic paste to it and cook until it turns golden.

steps.headline: Add chopped onions to the garlic paste and seeds mixture.
steps.description: Saute. Once they turn translucent, add the tomato ketchup and tin-packed beans to it.

steps.headline: Add red chilli powder and salt.
steps.description: Let it cook. Once the preparation is cooked, turn off gas and let the whole thing cool down.

steps.headline: Put the bread slices in a pop-up toaster.
steps.description: Toast them until they turn golden-brown, then let them cool down.

steps.headline: Lay the toasted bread slices out.
steps.description: Spread the bean preparation over them.

steps.headline: Sprinkle chopped capsicum (bell pepper) and olives on it.
Grate a block of processed Cheese and sprinkle loads of grated Cheese over the preparation.
Place the whole thing in a pre-heated top-down grill or a gas tandoor.
Once you see the cheese melt, take it out.
steps.description: Serve. The hot and spicy Mexican bean toast is ready to savour.

text: Heat the oil in a pan. Add the cumin seeds to the oil and cook until they oil sputters. Then add half teaspoon of garlic paste to it and cook until it turns golden. Add chopped onions to the garlic paste and seeds mixture. Saute. Once they turn translucent, add the tomato ketchup and tin-packed beans to it. Add red chilli powder and salt. Let it cook. Once the preparation is cooked, turn off gas and let the whole thing cool down. Put the bread slices in a pop-up toaster. Toast them until they turn golden-brown, then let them cool down. Lay the toasted bread slices out. Spread the bean preparation over them. Sprinkle chopped capsicum (bell pepper) and olives on it.  Grate a block of processed Cheese and sprinkle loads of grated Cheese over the preparation.  Place the whole thing in a pre-heated top-down grill or a gas tandoor. Let it grill. Once you see the cheese melt, take it out. Serve. The hot and spicy Mexican bean toast is ready to savour.
